subject: tox respects upper-constraints.txt
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-06-03 17:14:19.000000000', 'files': ['tools/tox_install.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "tox respects upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

There are a few 'post' jobs as Andreas has mentioned on this review,
that have the install_command overridden (until that will be supported
in upstream infra).

This change has been inspired by

commit_message:
tox respects upper-constraints.txt

This will force pip install to use the upper-constraints.txt specified
version of pip modules. When you don't do this, you are out on the
bleeding edge and become unstable everytime some python library in the
wide world changes in a way that you don't expect.

There are a few 'post' jobs as Andreas has mentioned on this review,
that have the install_command overridden (until that will be supported
in upstream infra).

This change has been inspired by
Ie1133e4c020106e8098685ba9125f84b356d8e0c , notes from jaegerandi in the
openstack/glance's tox.ini file and Ihar's python-neutronclient's fix
I33302cdcab980a42c39dc9ec1e430add459615ff

Change-Id: I1f8be8184683c9a3671f750ebaa87c38163c9795
Closes-Bug: 1563038
cherry-picked from commit acfb57499e9d416f9cc0419593223e07fd097eea

commit_message:
Return raw subfields on facets of analyzed string fields

Facet options don't work well on analyzed string fields right now
because the aggregation runs on the tokens. Many of the string
fields we might want to give facet options for, however, have
subfields used for sorting which are not analyzed. Facet should
returne these subfields instead of the actual field.

Change-Id: Iae0622186934d1583f18c6c3c480e936e418fc3e
Closes-Bug: #1558884

commit_message:
Correct es 2.x functional test config

Adds some required ES 2.x config options that are preventing it from
starting during functional tests. Removes the code suppressing stdout
and stderr for e-s which makes it much harder to diagnose problems.

Also disables four tests that currently cannot pass under e-s. One
of these failures is https://bugs.launchpad.net/searchlight/+bug/1588540;
a separate issue is responsible for the others and I will file a bug
once those are diagnosed, but I want to unblock the gate.

Change-Id: I340322f86ae07bb86d77a79fbb0abeb25c5c6ead
Closes-Bug: #1588933

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 14:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'lib/astute/task.rb', 'lib/astute/server/dispatcher.rb', 'lib/fuel_deployment/cluster.rb', 'lib/astute/task_cluster.rb', 'spec/unit/orchestrator_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/task_cluster_spec.rb', 'tests/test_node.rb', 'lib/astute/puppet_task.rb', 'lib/fuel_deployment/node.rb', 'tests/deployment.rb', 'lib/astute/task_deployment.rb', 'lib/astute/task_node.rb', 'lib/fuel_deployment/task.rb', 'spec/spec_helper.rb', 'spec/unit/task_node_spec.rb', 'lib/fuel_deployment/graph.rb', 'spec/unit/fuel_deployment/cluster_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/fuel_deployment/node_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/task_deployment_spec.rb', 'lib/astute/orchestrator.rb'], 'message': 'Gracefully stop if tolerance limit exceeded

Several changes:

- support fault tolerance group;
- support internal stop deployment instead of raise in
  case of error;
- do not show last run summary debug report from mcollective;
- fix support of detecting offline nodes before run deployment;
- support fail on error behavior.

Support fault tolerance group

  Nailgun send fault tolerance group which inform Astute about
  available number of error nodes in this deployment and importance
  of every node in this task.

If number of error exceeds number of available errors, deployment
will stop.

  Support internal stop deployment instead of raise in case of error

  Before this change Astute is end processing, marks all nodes
  as error and do not waiting of puppet process on nodes.

  Now we use same way that used in case of stop deployment.
  Mark failed nodes as error, another nodes as skipped(stopped),
  ready nodes as ready. Also Astute will wait before current
  tasks end.

Do not show last run summary debug report from mcollective

  For now moment it not so useful, but quickly filled log file
  and difficult debug process

Fix support of detecting offline nodes before run deployment

  Astute gets response from mcollective to detect node availability.
  If node do not respond, it will mark as failed. It also support
  fault tollerance mechanism

Support fail on error behavior

  From this moment task which setup fail_on_error if false,
  task marks as skipped instead of failed in case of error.

Change-Id: Ica2a4ae64b4dfa4f7fccfbc95108d1412c40dc3f
Closes-Bug: #1435610
(cherry picked from commit 5a9f87c08062d3f0a23116b1a339da3252a69f24)
'}]
commit_message:
Gracefully stop if tolerance limit exceeded

Several changes:

- support fault tolerance group;
- support internal stop deployment instead of raise in
  case of error;
- do not show last run summary debug report from mcollective;
- fix support of detecting offline nodes before run deployment;
- support fail on error behavior.

Support fault tolerance group

  Nailgun send fault tolerance group which inform Astute about
  available number of error nodes in this deployment and importance
  of every node in this task.

If number of error exceeds number of available errors, deployment
will stop.

  Support internal stop deployment instead of raise in case of error

  Before this change Astute is end processing, marks all nodes
  as error and do not waiting of puppet process on nodes.

  Now we use same way that used in case of stop deployment.
  Mark failed nodes as error, another nodes as skipped(stopped),
  ready nodes as ready. Also Astute will wait before current
  tasks end.

Do not show last run summary debug report from mcollective

  For now moment it not so useful, but quickly filled log file
  and difficult debug process

Fix support of detecting offline nodes before run deployment

  Astute gets response from mcollective to detect node availability.
  If node do not respond, it will mark as failed. It also support
  fault tollerance mechanism

Support fail on error behavior

  From this moment task which setup fail_on_error if false,
  task marks as skipped instead of failed in case of error.

Change-Id: Ica2a4ae64b4dfa4f7fccfbc95108d1412c40dc3f
Closes-Bug: #1435610
(cherry picked from commit 5a9f87c08062d3f0a23116b1a339da3252a69f24)

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-03-21 14:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/use-castellan-key-manager.rst'], 'message': 'Integrate Castellan for Key Management

Adds specification for integrating Castellan for key management.

Castellan is a key manager interface library that is intended to be
usable with multiple back ends, including Barbican. The Castellan code
is based on the basic key manager interface that resides in Nova and
Cinder. Now that the key manager interface lives in a separate library,
the key manager code can be removed from Nova and Cinder, and Castellan
can be used as the key manager interface instead.

Related: blueprint use-castellan-key-manager
Change-Id: I025995584e74c0b2df00841697714c10d1afb674
'}]
commit_message:
Integrate Castellan for Key Management

Adds specification for integrating Castellan for key management.

Castellan is a key manager interface library that is intended to be
usable with multiple back ends, including Barbican. The Castellan code
is based on the basic key manager interface that resides in Nova and
Cinder. Now that the key manager interface lives in a separate library,
the key manager code can be removed from Nova and Cinder, and Castellan
can be used as the key manager interface instead.

Related: blueprint use-castellan-key-manager
Change-Id: I025995584e74c0b2df00841697714c10d1afb674

commit_message:
Infra: Adding other-requirements.txt

Adding other-requirements.txt will allow us to install dependencies
which are not shipped by default by OpenStack infra.

Also modifies the tox.ini to check for the dependency management. The
other-requirements.txt file will override the default CI system
dependency management. Bindep should check if the required dependencies
are covered for the same.

Change-Id: I7bef0ab940708de45eb19f9497a80cc08130e646

commit_message:
Remove "or 'reserved'" from _create_volume_bdm

Just like in change I5cde374a2621b22b094d14e357a399a2fb784287,
the "or 'reserved'" logic when creating the BDM when there
isn't a volume_id is vestigial - a carry over from grizzly
and compute RPC API 2.0 which we don't use anymore.

So let's remove this since it's not used and confusing.

Change-Id: Ib06126c5c878bca66708dbe4ad95df469cbe6710
Related-Bug: #1533871

commit_message:
Change message format of Forbidden

Not authorized is usually related to '401' HTTP exception
and we probably will create a new UnAuthorized exception in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/312014/ with same message
so we can change this one to 'Forbidden'

Change-Id: I83c032efeae8d353c6c215a00b814e303560da80

commit_message:
Moving to Keystone v3 API

Updated documentation to reflect all the changes in Neutron code base,
necessary for receive full compatibility with new Keystone v3 API.
Added information about deprecation for "tenant_id" and updated
all the places where new "project_id" will be present.

Change-Id: I51f91ee0b882e776b50d95bf4345556100727c84
Depends-on: I504896d14903d3b37e5fee003ebd467e5fd3758e
Implements: blueprint keystone-v3

subject: Revert "Update management_from_pool template version to 2015-10-15"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-06-07 18:37:38.000000000', 'files': ['network/ports/management_from_pool.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Update management_from_pool template version to 2015-10-15"

This patch broke Nova, Ceilometer and Aodh deployments:

aodh::evaluator::coordination_url": "redis://:E6ZsxmfrDBbbsZ7gt9CtEHTMv@192.0.2.7:6379/"
nova::network::neutron::neutron_auth_url": "://:/v3
ceilometer::agent::central::coordination_url": "redis://:E6ZsxmfrDBbbsZ7gt9CtEHTMv@192.0.2.7:6379/"

This reverts commit f12588854274ab66824746519bf86614c29a1929.

Change-Id: I6d020e937c40e574aac44eed68eda50eb0c2eac2
Partial-Bug: #1590057
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Update management_from_pool template version to 2015-10-15"

This patch broke Nova, Ceilometer and Aodh deployments:

aodh::evaluator::coordination_url": "redis://:E6ZsxmfrDBbbsZ7gt9CtEHTMv@192.0.2.7:6379/"
nova::network::neutron::neutron_auth_url": "://:/v3
ceilometer::agent::central::coordination_url": "redis://:E6ZsxmfrDBbbsZ7gt9CtEHTMv@192.0.2.7:6379/"

This reverts commit f12588854274ab66824746519bf86614c29a1929.

Change-Id: I6d020e937c40e574aac44eed68eda50eb0c2eac2
Partial-Bug: #1590057

parameter (which is effectively a public interface, since it may be
overridden in an environment file). No configuration should end up with
different ports/protocols/hosts for Keystone v2 and v3, and somebody
customising them should not have to account for them separately. Nor
should things break when the need to distinguish between v2 and v3
endpoints goes away.

This change removes the KeystoneV3* keys from the EndpointMap input and
uses the Keystone* keys instead, so that any change to the internal
organisation becomes transparent to the user.

Change-Id: If4cdd9232f4dbc9f2af651bbdfe68f09dc26ed2e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't have separate protocols/ports for Keystone v3

The change in ab068a824ed51e78bf111387223e58e885ec5c84 is described as
temporary, so it would be better if it did not affect the EndpointMap
parameter (which is effectively a public interface, since it may be
overridden in an environment file). No configuration should end up with
different ports/protocols/hosts for Keystone v2 and v3, and somebody
customising them should not have to account for them separately. Nor
should things break when the need to distinguish between v2 and v3
endpoints goes away.

This change removes the KeystoneV3* keys from the EndpointMap input and
uses the Keystone* keys instead, so that any change to the internal
organisation becomes transparent to the user.

Change-Id: If4cdd9232f4dbc9f2af651bbdfe68f09dc26ed2e

commit_message:
Replace key manager with Castellan

Because key manager code is duplicated across several projects, a key
manager interface was moved into its own library. This patch goes back
to replace the old code with the new library.

Change-Id: Ib563b0ea4b8b4bc1833bf52bf49a68546c384996
Implements: blueprint use-castellan-key-manager
